intro: Mastichodendron pervillei, commonly known as the Madagascar mastic tree, is a unique evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants like the cashew and sumac. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature, containing a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
